pull_requests.title: interfaces, chain, refactor: Remove unused getTipLocator and incaccurate getActiveChainLocator
pull_requests.body:
Remove `Chain::getTipLocator`, `Chain::GetLocator()`, and `Chain::getActiveChainLocator`:
- `Chain::getTipLocator` is no longer used.
- `Chain::GetLocator`, replaced its call by `GetLocator()`, which uses `LocatorEntries`, avoiding direct access to the chain itself (change suggested by l0rinc while reviewing this PR to maintain consistency with the overall refactoring).
- `Chain::getActiveChainLocator`, whose name was misleading, has functionality redundant with Chain::findBlock.
  - Additionally, the comment for getActiveChainLocator became inaccurate following changes in commit https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/commit/ed470940cddbeb40425960d51cefeec4948febe4 (from PR #25717).


This is a [follow-up](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/29652#issuecomment-3151665095) to #29652.

comment_list.body:

### Reviews

| ---- | --------- |
| ACK | [furszy](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/33169#pullrequestreview-3116226163), [stickies-v](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/33169#pullrequestreview-3116242341), [w0xlt](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/33169#pullrequestreview-3117742645), [achow101](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/33169#issuecomment-3189428205) |
| Concept ACK | [bc1cindy](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/33169#issuecomment-3177406535), [l0rinc](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/33169#pullrequestreview-3114020735) |

If your review is incorrectly listed, please react with üëé to this comment and the bot will ignore it on the next update.
<!--174a7506f384e20aa4161008e828411d-->
### Conflicts
No conflicts as of last run.
<!--5faf32d7da4f0f540f40219e4f7537a3-->

> I think you could implement the second commit cleaner, and slightly more performant, by unifying the `findBlock` calls (only performing one at the beginning)

Thanks for the suggestion! I agree with it. I‚Äôll prepare a separate follow-up commit to refactor that, so the current second commit stays minimal and clearly shows the intended change.

When I first reviewed the code, I considered breaking down `CWallet::ScanForWalletTransactions` into smaller, more manageable pieces, which might be a worthwhile improvement in a separate PR. Please let me know if you also think that would be valuable.

> Thanks for the suggestion! I agree with it. I‚Äôll prepare a separate follow-up commit to refactor that, so the current second commit stays minimal and clearly shows the intended change.

I don't really think adding an another commit just for this makes much sense. Feel free to take the code if you like it. We are talking about a simple refactoring here.

> When I first reviewed the code, I considered breaking down CWallet::ScanForWalletTransactions into smaller, more manageable pieces, which might be a worthwhile improvement in a separate PR. Please let me know if you also think that would be valuable.

it will depend on how you split it. Not sure if you can do much there; most of the "extra" code is to show and save progress. The rest seems very simple to me.

Concept ACK

Tested by building successfully and running wallet functional tests.

Good cleanup of unused interfaces. I lean towards furszy's suggestion of unifying the findBlock calls - it's cleaner and avoids redundant lookups for the same block. Simple enough to include here.

<ins>_Updates_</ins>:
- Addressed feedback from @furszy, incorporating [suggested refactoring](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/33169#pullrequestreview-3107022031).
- Addressed [feedback](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/33169#discussion_r2268362028) from @l0rinc, removing `Chain::GetLocator()` function and replacing its call to be consistent with the overall refactoring done in the PR.

pull_requests.title: doc: Fix spelling mistake in current release notes
pull_requests.body:
Fix 'accomodate' -> 'accommodate' in release-notes-28.2.md

This fixes a spelling mistake in the current Bitcoin Core 28.2 release notes.

issues.title: KnapsackSolver missing doc comments
issues.body: The [KnapsackSolver](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/blob/daca51bf80e7168cefaf226262c5bcb3d9cc6148/src/wallet/coinselection.cpp#L652) is missing helpful doc comments about its usage.  Like CoinGrinder and BnB, it would be helpful if the solver explained it's usage, under what condition it's useful. description of parameters etc.

comment_list.body: Feel free to document it. Once all KnapsackSolver edge scenarios are properly described, we can consider deprecating it in favor of more targeted algorithms.

> Feel free to document it. Once all KnapsackSolver edge scenarios are properly described, we can consider deprecating it in favor of more targeted algorithms.

Alright.  I'll probably start with `SRD` which also needs docs..
If you are just going to do this, then it seems like any (further) discussion can just happen in the PR adding the docs. Closing this for now.
